# Accordion Accordions display a list of high-level options that can expand/collapse to reveal more information. ## Installation ## Import - **AccordionRoot**: All parts of the accordion are included. - **AccordionItem**: Includes all parts of the collapsible section. - **AccordionHeader**: This item switches the expand/collapse state of the accordion item. This item has a titled element. - **AccordionArrow**: Down arrow icon rotating based on expand/collapse state. - **AccordionContent**: Contains the collapsible content for an item. ### Another way to import ```js 'use client'; import { Accordion } from '@melio-ui/accordion';
Panel Title1
 Content1 ; ``` > 'use client' must be used when rendering on the server side. ## API Reference ### AccordionRoot All parts of the accordion are included. How to render accordion item.

selecting: Rendering only the currently expanded accordion item.
selected: Rendering accordion items that have been expanded.
force: Rendering all accordion items. ), }, { name: 'onValueChange', required: false, type: '(value: ExpandedValueType) => void', description: 'The callback invoked when expanded or collapsed an accordion item.', }, ]} /> ### AccordionItem Includes all parts of the collapsible section. React.ReactNode)', description: 'children of accordion item', }, ]} /> ### AccordionHeader This item switches the expand/collapse state of the accordion item. This item has a titled element. ### AccordionContent Contains the collapsible content for an item. ### AccordionArrowIcon Down arrow icon rotating based on expand/collapse state. ## Examples ### Expanded by defaultValue ```jsx render=true const DefaultValue = () => { return (
Panel Title1

# Alert Displays a description for the user's attention. ## Installation ## Import - **AlertRoot**: All parts of the alert are included. - **AlertStatusIcon**: Alert icon changes depending on status. - **AlertContent**: The content of the alert to be announced by screen readers. ### Another way to import ```js 'use client'; import { Alert } from '@melio-ui/alert'; Content1 ; ``` > 'use client' must be used when rendering on the server side. ## API Reference ### AlertRoot All parts of the alert are included. TypeAttributes.Status

"info" | "success" | "warning" | "error" ), description: 'The status of the alert.', }, ]} /> ### AlertStatusIcon Alert icon changes depending on status. ', type: 'React.ReactNode', description: 'displaying an icon for info status.', }, { name: 'success', required: false, default: '', type: 'React.ReactNode', description: 'displaying an icon for success status.', }, { name: 'warning', required: false, default: '', type: 'React.ReactNode', description: 'displaying an icon for warning status.', }, { name: 'error', required: false, default: '', type: 'React.ReactNode', description: 'displaying an icon for error status.', }, ]} /> ### AlertContent The content of the alert to be announced by screen readers. ## Examples ### Set the status value ```jsx This is an success alert ``` ### Custom ```jsx
information
This is an info alert
 ```

# Avatar

<Description>An alternative image element for user representation.</Description>

<DemoContainer>
  <AvatarDemo />
  <DemoCodeBlock component="avatar" />
</DemoContainer>

## Installation

<PackageManagers
  command={{
    npm: 'npm i @melio-ui/avatar',
    yarn: 'yarn add @melio-ui/avatar',
    pnpm: 'pnpm add @melio-ui/avatar',
    bun: 'bun add @melio-ui/avatar',
  }}
/>

## Import

<ImportSyntax
  command={{
    individual: `import { 
  AvatarRoot,
  AvatarImg,
  AvatarGroup,
  AvatarGroupContent,
  AvatarExtra,
} from '@melio-ui/avatar';`,
    global: `import { 
  AvatarRoot,
  AvatarImg,
  AvatarGroup,
  AvatarGroupContent,
  AvatarExtra,
} from '@melio-ui/react';`,
  }}
/>

- **AvatarRoot**: All parts of the avatar are included.
- **AvatarImg**: The image to render. By default, it will only be rendered when loaded.
- **AvatarGroup**: It is a wrapper that stacks multiple avatars together.
- **AvatarGroupContent**: When using AvatarGroup, an avatar component is included.
- **AvatarExtra**: When using AvatarGroup, extra space above the maximum number of avatars is displayed.

### Another way to import

```js
'use client';

import { Avatar } from '@melio-ui/avatar';

<Avatar.Root>
  <Avatar.Img />
</Avatar.Root>;
```

> 'use client' must be used when rendering on the server side.

## API Reference

### AvatarRoot

All parts of the avatar are included.

### AvatarImg

The image to render. By default, it will only be rendered when loaded.

<PropsTable
  data={[
    {
      name: 'src',
      required: false,
      type: 'string',
      description: 'The src attribute of the img element.',
    },
    {
      name: 'srcSet',
      required: false,
      type: 'string',
      description: 'The srcset attribute of the img element.',
    },
    {
      name: 'sizes',
      required: false,
      type: 'string',
      description: 'The sizes attribute of the img element.',
    },
    {
      name: 'alt',
      required: false,
      type: 'string',
      description: 'The alt attribute of the img element.',
    },
    {
      name: 'crossOrigin',
      required: false,
      type: '"anonymous" | "use-credentials" | ""',
      description: 'The crossorigin attribute of the img element.',
    },
    {
      name: 'referrerPolicy',
      required: false,
      type: 'React.HTMLAttributeReferrerPolicy',
      description: 'The referrerpolicy attribute of the img element.',
    },
  ]}
/>

### AvatarGroup

It is a wrapper that stacks multiple avatars together.

<PropsTable
  data={[
    {
      name: 'max',
      required: false,
      default: '5',
      type: 'number',
      description: 'The maximum number of avatars that can be displayed.',
    },
  ]}
/>

### AvatarGroupContent

When using AvatarGroup, an avatar component is included.

### AvatarExtra

When using AvatarGroup, extra space above the maximum number of avatars is displayed.

<PropsTable
  data={[
    {
      name: 'asChild',
      required: false,
      type: 'boolean',
      description:
        'Changes the default rendering element passed as a child, merging its props and behavior.',
    },
  ]}
/>

## Examples

### Loading the image.

```jsx
<AvatarRoot>
  <AvatarImg src="http://bit.ly/3XZx3ZU" />
</AvatarRoot>
```

### Grouping

```jsx
<AvatarGroup>
  <AvatarGroupContent>
    <AvatarRoot>
      <UserIcon />
    </AvatarRoot>
    <AvatarRoot>
      <UserIcon />
    </AvatarRoot>
    <AvatarRoot>
      <UserIcon />
    </AvatarRoot>
  </AvatarGroupContent>
</AvatarGroup>
```

### Setting the maximum value

```jsx
<AvatarGroup max={2}>
  <AvatarGroupContent>
    <AvatarRoot>
      <UserIcon />
    </AvatarRoot>
    <AvatarRoot>
      <UserIcon />
    </AvatarRoot>
    <AvatarRoot>
      <UserIcon />
    </AvatarRoot>
  </AvatarGroupContent>
  <AvatarExtra />
</AvatarGroup>
```

# Badge Badges are used to display small numeric values or status descriptors for UI elements. ## Installation ## Import - **BadgeRoot**: All parts of the badge are included. - **BadgeContent**: Elements that display a small numeric value or status description. ### Another way to import ```js 'use client'; import { Badge } from '@melio-ui/badge'; ; ``` > 'use client' must be used when rendering on the server side. ## API Reference ### BadgeRoot All parts of the badge are included. TypeAttributes.Placement

"top" | "top-left" | "top-right" | "bottom" | "bottom-left" | "bottom-right" ), description: 'Specifies the location of the value.', }, ]} /> ### BadgeContent Elements that display a small numeric value or status description. ## Examples ### Setting the maximum value ```jsx {1000} ``` ### Placement ```jsx {10} ``` ### Only value ```jsx {10} ```

# Breadcrumb Displays the path to the current resource as a link hierarchy. ## Installation ## Import - **BreadcrumbRoot**: All parts of the breadcrumb are included. - **BreadcrumbList**: A container for breadcrumb items. - **BreadcrumbItem**: An individual breadcrumb element containing a link and a divider. - **BreadcrumbLink**: The breadcrumb link. - **BreadcrumbSeparator**: The visual separator between each breadcrumb element. - **BreadcrumbCollapse**: Display collapsed breadcrumbs. ### Another way to import ```js 'use client'; import { Breadcrumb } from '@melio-ui/breadcrumb'; ; ``` > 'use client' must be used when rendering on the server side. ## API Reference ### BreadcrumbRoot All parts of the breadcrumb are included. ### BreadcrumbList A container for breadcrumb items. The maximum number of breadcrumb items that can be displayed.

When setting maxItems, collapse must also be set. ), }, { name: 'collapse', required: false, default: '...', type: 'React.ReactNode', description: 'collapse node.', }, ]} /> ### BreadcrumbItem An individual breadcrumb element containing a link and a divider. ### BreadcrumbLink The breadcrumb link. ### BreadcrumbSeparator The visual separator between each breadcrumb element. ### BreadcrumbCollapse Display collapsed breadcrumbs. ## Examples ### Custom separator ```jsx Home {'>'} Page {'>'} Current ``` ### Max When setting maxItems, collapse must also be set. ```jsx }> Home Page1 Page2 Page3 Current ``` ### Custom Collapsed ```jsx ~~~}> Home Page1 Page2 Page3 Current ```

## Import

```js
import { Button, ButtonGroup } from '@ui';
```

- **Button:** The button component with support for custom icons, spinners, etc.
- **ButtonGroup:** Used to group buttons whose actions are related, with an
  option to flush them together.

## Usage

```jsx live=true
<Button>Button</Button>
```

# Drawer The Drawer component is a sliding panel from the screen's edge, useful for tasks or viewing details without leaving the current page. ## Installation ## Import - **DrawerRoot**: All parts of the drawer are included. - **DrawerTrigger**: Used to activate or open the Drawer component. - **DrawerPortal**: Portal the overlay and content portion into the body. - **DrawerBackdrop**: A layer that covers the inactive portion of the view when a dialog box is opened. - **DrawerContent**: Includes the content that will be displayed in the open dialog box. - **DrawerClose**: The button that closes the dialog. ### Another way to import ```js 'use client'; import { Drawer } from '@melio-ui/drawer'; Title ); } render(); function Title(props) { const { children } = props; return (
{children}
); } function CloseButton(props) { return ( ); } ``` ### Custom Size ```jsx ``` ### Prevent closing when clicking on the backdrop. ```jsx ```

# Dropdown Displays a menu to the user, offering a series of actions or functions that can be executed by clicking buttons. ## Installation ## Import - **DropdownRoot**: All parts of the dropdown are included. - **DropdownTrigger**: Used to activate or open the Dropdown component. - **DropdownPortal**: Portal the overlay and content portion into the body. - **DropdownContent**: Includes the content that will be displayed in the open menu box. - **DropdownArrow**: An optional arrow element for the dropdown, to be rendered within DropdownContent for visual association. - **DropdownItem**: It represents a single item in a dropdown menu and can be customized with labels, icons, and actions. ### Another way to import ```js 'use client'; import { Dropdown } from '@melio-ui/dropdown'; DropdownItem - 1 DropdownItem - 2 DropdownItem - 3 ; ``` > 'use client' must be used when rendering on the server side. ## API Reference ### DropdownRoot All parts of the dropdown are included. void', description: 'This is an event handler that is triggered when the open state of the dropdown menu changes.', }, ]} /> ### DropdownTrigger Used to activate or open the Dropdown component. ### DropdownPortal Portal the overlay and content portion into the body. HTMLElement)', description: 'Specifies the container element to which the content should be portaled.', }, ]} /> ### DropdownContent Includes the content that will be displayed in the open menu box. ### DropdownArrow An optional arrow element for the dropdown, to be rendered within DropdownContent for visual association. ### DropdownItem It represents a single item in a dropdown menu and can be customized with labels, icons, and actions. ## Examples ### Position of dropdown menu ```jsx DropdownItem - 1 DropdownItem - 2 DropdownItem - 3 ``` ### Display arrow ```jsx DropdownItem - 1 DropdownItem - 2 DropdownItem - 3 ``` ### Custom Dropdown Menu ```jsx
Title 1
DropdownItem - 1 DropdownItem - 2 DropdownItem - 3
Title 2
DropdownItem - 4 DropdownItem - 5 DropdownItem - 6
```

# NumberInput The NumberInput component is like the Input component but includes controls to adjust a numeric value. ## Installation ## Import - **NumberInputRoot**: All parts of the number input are included. - **NumberInputField**: The input field itself. - **NumberInputButtonGroup**: A wrapper for the input's increment and decrement buttons. - **NumberInputPlus**: This button increases the input value. - **NumberInputMinus**: This button decreases the input value. ### Another way to import ```js 'use client'; import { NumberInput } from '@melio-ui/number-input'; ; ``` > 'use client' must be used when rendering on the server side. ## API Reference ### NumberInputRoot All parts of the number input are included. NumberInputValue

number | null ), description: 'The number input value.', }, { name: 'defaultValue', required: false, type: ( <> NumberInputValue

number | null ), description: "The initial value of the number input when first rendered, for use when state control isn't needed.", }, { name: 'disabled', required: false, type: 'boolean', description: 'Determines if the input field and buttons are disabled.', }, { name: 'min', required: false, default: '-Infinity', type: 'number', description: 'Minimum value of number input.', }, { name: 'max', required: false, default: 'Infinity', type: 'number', description: 'Maximum value for numeric input.', }, { name: 'step', required: false, default: '1', type: 'number', description: 'Steps used to increase or decrease values.', }, { name: 'onValueChange', required: false, type: '(value: NumberInputValue) => void', description: 'An event handler that is called when the value changes.', }, ]} /> ### NumberInputField The input field itself. ### NumberInputButtonGroup A wrapper for the input's increment and decrement buttons. ### NumberInputPlus This button increases the input value. ### NumberInputMinus This button decreases the input value. ## Examples ### Set the minimum and maximum values ```jsx ``` ### Set step size ```jsx ``` ### Custom Style ```jsx ```

# Popover A popover is a floating non-modal dialog box. ## Installation ## Import - **PopoverRoot**: All parts of the popover are included. - **PopoverTrigger**: Used to activate or open the Popover component. - **PopoverPortal**: Portal the overlay and content portion into the body. - **PopoverContent**: Includes the content that will be displayed in the open menu box. - **PopoverArrow**: An optional arrow element for the popover, to be rendered within PopoverContent for visual association. - **PopoverClose**: The button that closes the menu. ### Another way to import ```js 'use client'; import { Popover } from '@melio-ui/popover';
This is a Popover Content
 ; ``` > 'use client' must be used when rendering on the server side. ## API Reference ### PopoverRoot All parts of the popover are included. void', description: 'This is an event handler that is triggered when the open state of the popover content changes.', }, ]} /> ### PopoverTrigger Used to activate or open the Popover component. ### PopoverPortal Portal the overlay and content portion into the body. HTMLElement)', description: 'Specifies the container element to which the content should be portaled.', }, ]} /> ### PopoverContent Includes the content that will be displayed in the open menu box. ### PopoverArrow An optional arrow element for the popover, to be rendered within PopoverContent for visual association. ### PopoverClose The button that closes the menu. ## Examples ### Position of popover content ```jsx
This is a Popover Content

This is a Popover Content
 ``` ### Click the button to close ```jsx render=true function PopoverCloseButton() { return (
This is a Popover Content
 ); } render(); function CloseIconButton(props) { return ( ); } ```

# RadioGroup A set of radio buttons where only one can be checked at a time. ## Installation ## Import - **RadioGroupRoot**: All parts of the radio group are included. - **RadioGroupItem**: A checkable group item with an input for proper event propagation in forms. - **RadioGroupIndicator**: Renders when the radio item is checked, allowing direct styling or use as an icon wrapper. - **RadioGroupIcon**: Indicates whether the status is checked or unchecked. - **RadioGroupLabel**: Display text. ### Another way to import ```js 'use client'; import { RadioGroup } from '@melio-ui/radio-group'; radio1 radio2 ; ``` > 'use client' must be used when rendering on the server side. ## API Reference ### RadioGroupRoot All parts of the radio group are included. TypeAttributes.Orientation

"horizontal" | "vertical" ), description: 'Direction for the placement of the RadioGroup component.', }, { name: 'disabled', required: false, type: 'boolean', description: 'Determines whether the radio group is inactive.', }, { name: 'onValueChange', required: false, type: ( <> {`(value: RadioValue) => void`}

RadioValue: string | number ), description: 'This is an event handler that is triggered when the state of a radio group changes.', }, ]} /> ### RadioGroupItem A checkable group item with an input for proper event propagation in forms. {`React. InputHTMLAttributes `} ), description: 'Attributes assigned to the input element.', }, ]} /> ### RadioGroupIndicator Renders when the radio item is checked, allowing direct styling or use as an icon wrapper. React.ReactNode', description: 'Elements rendered when a radio is checked.', }, ]} /> ### RadioGroupIcon Indicates whether the status is checked or unchecked. ### RadioGroupLabel Display text. ## Examples ### defaultChecked ```jsx Radio1 Radio2 Radio3 ``` ### disabled ```jsx Radio1 Radio2 Radio3 ``` ### Indicator children function ```jsx render=true function IndicatorFunc() { return ( {(checked: boolean) => { if (checked) return ; return ; }} User1 {(checked: boolean) => { if (checked) return ; return ; }} User2 {(checked: boolean) => { if (checked) return ; return ; }} User3 ); } render(); function CheckedUserIcon() { return ( ); } function UncheckedUserIcon() { return ( ); } ``` ### Checked/Unchecked Icon ```jsx render=true function CustomRadioIcon() { return ( } uncheckedIcon={} /> User1 } uncheckedIcon={} /> User2 } uncheckedIcon={} /> User3 ); } render(); function CheckedUserIcon() { return ( ); } function UncheckedUserIcon() { return ( ); } ``` ### Orientation ```jsx Radio1 Radio2 Radio3 ```

# Slider An input that allows the user to choose a value within a specified range. ## Installation ## Import - **SliderRoot**: All parts of the slider are included. - **SliderTrack**: The unfilled portion of the slider that displays the track. - **SliderRange**: The filled portion of the slider. - **SliderThumb**: The knob used to adjust the slider value. - **SliderThumbLabel**: The label displayed for slider values. ### Another way to import ```js 'use client'; import { Slider } from '@melio-ui/slider'; ; ``` > 'use client' must be used when rendering on the server side. ## API Reference ### SliderRoot All parts of the slider are included. TypeAttributes.Orientation

"horizontal" | "vertical" ), description: 'Direction for the placement of the Slider component.', }, { name: 'disabled', required: false, type: 'boolean', description: 'Determines whether the slider is inactive.', }, { name: 'onValueChange', required: false, type: '(value: number | number[], activeIndex: number) => void', description: 'This is an event handler that is triggered when the state of a slider changes.', }, ]} /> ### SliderTrack The unfilled portion of the slider that displays the track. ### SliderRange The filled portion of the slider. ### SliderThumb The knob used to adjust the slider value. ### SliderThumbLabel The label displayed for slider values. ## Examples ### Disabled ```jsx ``` ### Set the minimum and maximum values ```jsx ``` ### Set step size ```jsx ``` ### Display Thumb Label ```jsx ``` ### Orientation ```jsx ``` ### Range ```jsx ```

# Steps Steps communicate progress through numbered steps, providing a wizard-like workflow. ## Installation ## Import - **StepsRoot**: All parts of the steps are included. - **StepsStep**: A single step in the sequence. - **StepsIndicator**: A component displaying markers that update as the user advances through steps, clearly tracking progress. - **StepsStatus**: Indicates the status of the step. - **StepsContent**: Additional content for a step. - **StepsSeparator**: Divider between steps. ### Another way to import ```js 'use client'; import { Steps } from '@melio-ui/steps';
Step01

"finish" | "wait" | "process" | "error" ), description: 'Sets the state of the step.', }, ]} /> ### StepsIndicator A component displaying markers that update as the user advances through steps, clearly tracking progress. React.ReactNode', description: 'An element that renders the state of a step.', }, ]} /> ### StepsStatus Indicates the status of the step. ### StepsContent Additional content for a step. React.ReactNode', description: 'An element that renders the content of a step.', }, ]} /> ### StepsSeparator Divider between steps. ## Examples ### Set status on step ```jsx

# Tabs A series of layered content sections, called tab panels, that are shown one at a time. ## Installation ## Import - **TabsRoot**: All parts of the tabs are included. - **TabsList**: Contains the buttons or tabs aligned with the edge of the active content. - **TabsTab**: This button activates related content. - **TabsContent**: Includes content related to each tab. ### Another way to import ```js 'use client'; import { Tabs } from '@melio-ui/tabs'; Tab1 Tab2

TabContent1

TabContent2

 ; ``` > 'use client' must be used when rendering on the server side. ## API Reference ### TabsRoot All parts of the tabs are included. TypeAttributes.Orientation

"horizontal" | "vertical" ), description: 'Direction for the placement of the Tabs component.', }, { name: 'renderMode', required: false, type: '"selecting" | "selected" | "force"', default: '"selecting"', description: ( <> How to render tab content.

selecting: Rendering only the currently activated tab content.
selected: Rendering tab contents that have been activated.
force: Rendering all tab contents. ), }, { name: 'onValueChange', required: false, type: '(value: string) => void', description: 'The callback invoked when a tab content is activated.', }, ]} /> ### TabsList Contains the buttons or tabs aligned with the edge of the active content. ### TabsTab This button activates related content. ### TabsContent Includes content related to each tab. ## Examples ### defaultValue ```jsx Tab1 Tab2 Tab3

TabContent1

# Tooltip

<Description>
  A popup displaying information when an element receives keyboard focus or mouse hover.
</Description>

<DemoContainer>
  <TooltipDemo />
  <DemoCodeBlock component="tooltip" />
</DemoContainer>

## Installation

<PackageManagers
  command={{
    npm: 'npm i @melio-ui/tooltip',
    yarn: 'yarn add @melio-ui/tooltip',
    pnpm: 'pnpm add @melio-ui/tooltip',
    bun: 'bun add @melio-ui/tooltip',
  }}
/>

## Import

<ImportSyntax
  command={{
    individual: `import { 
  TooltipRoot,
  TooltipTrigger,
  TooltipPortal,
  TooltipContent,
  TooltipArrow,
} from '@melio-ui/tooltip';`,
    global: `import { 
  TooltipRoot,
  TooltipTrigger,
  TooltipPortal,
  TooltipContent,
  TooltipArrow,
} from '@melio-ui/react';`,
  }}
/>

- **TooltipRoot**: All parts of the tooltip are included.
- **TooltipTrigger**: Used to activate or open the Tooltip component.
- **TooltipPortal**: Portal the overlay and content portion into the body.
- **TooltipContent**: Includes the content that will be displayed in the open tooltip.
- **TooltipArrow**: An optional arrow element for the tooltip, to be rendered within TooltipContent for visual association.

### Another way to import

```js
'use client';

import { Tooltip } from '@melio-ui/tooltip';

<Tooltip.Root>
  <Tooltip.Trigger asChild>
    <button>Tooltip</button>
  </Tooltip.Trigger>
  <Tooltip.Portal>
    <Tooltip.Content>
      tooltip message
      <Tooltip.Arrow />
    </Tooltip.Content>
  </Tooltip.Portal>
</Tooltip.Root>;
```

> 'use client' must be used when rendering on the server side.

## API Reference

### TooltipRoot

All parts of the tooltip are included.

<PropsTable
  data={[
    {
      name: 'open',
      required: false,
      type: 'boolean',
      description: 'Sets whether the tooltip content is open or closed.',
    },
    {
      name: 'defaultOpen',
      required: false,
      type: 'boolean',
      description:
        'When first rendered, the tooltip content is in an opened state. Use when there is no need to control the opened state.',
    },
    {
      name: 'onOpenChange',
      required: false,
      type: '(open: boolean) => void',
      description:
        'This is an event handler that is triggered when the open state of the tooltip content changes.',
    },
  ]}
/>

### TooltipTrigger

Used to activate or open the Tooltip component.

<PropsTable
  data={[
    {
      name: 'asChild',
      required: false,
      type: 'boolean',
      description:
        'Changes the default rendering element passed as a child, merging its props and behavior.',
    },
  ]}
/>

<DataAttributesTable
  data={[
    {
      attribute: '[data-state]',
      values: '"open" | "closed"',
    },
  ]}
/>

### TooltipPortal

Portal the overlay and content portion into the body.

<PropsTable
  data={[
    {
      name: 'container',
      required: false,
      default: 'document.body',
      type: 'HTMLElement | (() => HTMLElement)',
      description: 'Specifies the container element to which the content should be portaled.',
    },
  ]}
/>

### TooltipContent

Includes the content that will be displayed in the open tooltip.

<PropsTable
  data={[
    {
      name: 'side',
      required: false,
      default: '"top"',
      type: '"top" | "right" | "bottom" | "left"',
      description: "The ideal side of the trigger to render on when it's open.",
    },
    {
      name: 'sideOffset',
      required: false,
      default: '0',
      type: 'number',
      description: 'The pixel distance from the trigger.',
    },
    {
      name: 'align',
      required: false,
      default: '"center"',
      type: '"start" | "center" | "end"',
      description: 'The desired alignment with the trigger, which may adjust if collisions happen.',
    },
    {
      name: 'alignOffset',
      required: false,
      default: '0',
      type: 'number',
      description: 'A pixel offset from the "start" or "end" alignment choices.',
    },
  ]}
/>

<DataAttributesTable
  data={[
    {
      attribute: '[data-state]',
      values: '"open" | "closed"',
    },
    {
      attribute: '[data-side]',
      values: '"top" | "right" | "bottom" | "left"',
    },
    {
      attribute: '[data-align]',
      values: '"start" | "center" | "end"',
    },
  ]}
/>

### TooltipArrow

An optional arrow element for the tooltip, to be rendered within TooltipContent for visual association.

<PropsTable
  data={[
    {
      name: 'asChild',
      required: false,
      type: 'boolean',
      description:
        'Changes the default rendering element passed as a child, merging its props and behavior.',
    },
    {
      name: 'width',
      required: false,
      default: '10',
      type: 'number',
      description: "The arrow's width measured in pixels.",
    },
    {
      name: 'height',
      required: false,
      default: '5',
      type: 'number',
      description: "The arrow's height measured in pixels.",
    },
  ]}
/>

## Examples

### Display arrow

```jsx
<TooltipRoot>
  <TooltipTrigger asChild>
    <button type="button" style={{ width: 200, border: '1px solid #5f76bb', padding: 5 }}>
      Hover me
    </button>
  </TooltipTrigger>
  <TooltipPortal>
    <TooltipContent>
      tooltip message
      <TooltipArrow />
    </TooltipContent>
  </TooltipPortal>
</TooltipRoot>
```

### Position Settings

```jsx
<TooltipRoot>
  <TooltipTrigger asChild>
    <button type="button" style={{ width: 200, border: '1px solid #5f76bb', padding: 5 }}>
      Hover me
    </button>
  </TooltipTrigger>
  <TooltipPortal>
    <TooltipContent side="bottom" align="end">
      tooltip message
      <TooltipArrow />
    </TooltipContent>
  </TooltipPortal>
</TooltipRoot>
```
